etymology.description: 芥(芥) (gài, "mustard; herb") + 蓝(藍) (lán, "blue; indigo") = a type of vegetable resembling mustard, often with associated blue-green leaves, thus known as Chinese broccoli.
etymology.interpretation: 芥(芥) (gài, "mustard; herb") and 蓝(藍) (lán, "blue; indigo") combine to describe a leafy green vegetable, commonly known as Chinese broccoli. The term likely refers to the vegetable's mustard-like qualities and its typical blue-green leaf color.
etymology.simplification: 芥(芥) was simplified to 芥 and 藍 was simplified to 蓝.

examples.chinese: 这道菜里有芥蓝(芥藍)，味道非常鲜美(味道非常鮮美)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè dào cài lǐ yǒu gàilán, wèidào fēicháng xiānměi.
examples.english: This dish contains Chinese broccoli, and its flavor is very fresh and delicious.
